newsitem.title: INDIA: Mill demand arrests slide in India Gujarat cotton.
newsitem.headline: Mill demand arrests slide in India Gujarat cotton.

text.p: Gujarat cotton held steady at the reduced level on Wednesday, dealers said.
Gujarat cotton was down by 100/300 rupees per candy (355.56 kg) on Tuesday. Poor arrivals at the fag end of the season and fresh mill enquiries arrested further slide, they said.
Punjab cotton was quiet in limited activity. In spot deals Gujarat Kalyan was steady at 11,800/12,000 rupees per candy while Wagad variety remained quiet at 10,400/10,500 rupees.
Punjab saw-ginned was quoted at 1,675/1,700 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Bengal-deshi remained at 880/950 rupees per maund. Sentiments was subdued and volumes poor, dealers said.
